beans.description:
$Id$
This adaptor does the following...
* reads an xml document from books.xml * converts from xml into an OrderedMap * set {totalValue} to be the product of {price} and {quantity}. * converts map to a delimited string * writes to stdout
It is designed to illustrate adding using an expression to compute attribute values.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringApplication -config SetComputedValue.xml -bean Adaptor
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
writes to stdout
This example illustrates the use of openadaptor Expressions (using Ordered Maps) Simple example to illustrate using an expression to set value of a field based on the values of two others. This example also illustrates the use of attribute type maps.
Data originates: File Data processed : XML Records converted to Ordered Maps Data processed : Various expressions are applied to the maps Data terminates: Delimited Text to stdout

bean.description: Read in an entire xml document consisting of multiple child records

property.name: expression
property.description: Convert each child record in the xml document into an ordered map. Batch the ordered maps. One ordered map is created for each child record and added to the batch.

property.name: omitTopLevelElementTag
property.description: As we don't want each record to retain it's parent tag, to set omitTopLevelElementTag to true. This allows each child to be treated as an independent ordered map.

bean.description: This example sets a record value as the result of an expression. It calculates price * quantity and stores it as totalValue
The (optional) attributeTypeMap allows specification of type conversions for incoming values into appropriate types for expression. Supported types are Double,Long,Date and String.

property.name: attributeName
property.description: This is attribute where the result of the expression is stored.
